templates.name: Cisco Intersight
templates.description:
This templates connects to Intersight by a single host. 
LLD discovers Computer (Blade & Rack) but can be expanded to anything Intersight controls

items.name: Network Elements JSON
items.description:
Used for Autodiscover

This ITEM can potentially detect all type of Network Elements, not just Fabric Interconnect. Each Autodiscover rule should filter on SwitchType to match the right Equipment Template.

items.name: Chassis JSON
items.description:
Used for running Discovery rules

isctl get equipment chassis --filter "Moid eq '5d043f5a6176752d311de58d'" --expand 'Blades($select=Name,Moid)'

Expand Blades, used to get Moid, Name from each Bladeunit, select is used to limit the result

discovery_rules.name: Cisco Intersight Blade Servers
discovery_rules.description: This LLD Detects installed bladeunits in Chassis

item_prototypes.name: Fan {#ID} - Active Alarms
item_prototypes.description:
CLI Command

isctl get cond alarm --filter "Fansmodule.Moid eq '5effb6d86176752d34ab0428'"

trigger_prototypes.expression: in(last(/Cisco Intersight Blade Chassis/isctl["get", "cond", "alarm", "--filter", "Fansmodule.Moid eq '[{#MOID}]'"]),"No Active Alarms")=0
trigger_prototypes.name: Fan {#ID} - Active Alarms

trigger_prototypes.expression: in(last(/Cisco Intersight Blade Chassis/isctl["get", "cond", "alarm", "--filter", "Psus.Moid eq '[{#MOID}]'"]),"No Active Alarms")=0
trigger_prototypes.name: PSU {#ID} - Active Alarms

items.name: Bladeunit JSON
items.description:
Used for running Discovery rules

isctl get compute blade moid 59a5a5a1103b880001653567

triggers.name: Operability is not detected as operable

items.name: Alarms on Compute Unit
items.description:
isctl["get", "cond", "alarm", "—filter", "AffectedMoId eq '{HOST.HOST}'"]

Example CLI Commandisctl get cond alarm --filter "AffectedMoId eq '5a2ba72929378e00019e3e8d'"

triggers.name: Alarms on Compute Unit
triggers.opdata: Alarms on Compute unit is now detected as {ITEM.LASTVALUE}

triggers.name: HCL SoftwareStatus not Validated
triggers.opdata: HCL SoftwareStatus is now detected as {ITEM.LASTVALUE}

triggers.name: HCL Status not validated
triggers.event_name: HCL Status is now detected as {ITEM.LASTVALUE}

items.name: HCL Status JSON
items.description:
CLI Command

isctl get cond hclstatus --filter "ManagedObject.Moid eq '59a5a5a1103b880001653564'"

isctl["get", "compute", "rackunit", "—filter", "Moid eq '59a5a5a1103b880001653567'"]

triggers.name: Operability is not detected as operable

items.name: Rackunit JSON
items.description:
Used for running Discovery rules

isctl get compute rackunit moid 59a5a5a1103b880001653567

items.name: Alarms on Compute Unit
items.description:
isctl["get", "cond", "alarm", "—filter", "AffectedMoId eq '{HOST.HOST}'"]

Example CLI Commandisctl get cond alarm --filter "AffectedMoId eq '5a2ba72929378e00019e3e8d'"

triggers.name: Alarms on Compute Unit
triggers.opdata: Alarms on Compute unit is now detected as {ITEM.LASTVALUE}

item_prototypes.name: Fan {#ID} - Active Alarms
item_prototypes.description:
CLI Command

isctl get cond alarm --filter "Fansmodule.Moid eq '5effb6d86176752d34ab0428'"

trigger_prototypes.expression: in(last(/Cisco Intersight Rackservers/isctl["get", "cond", "alarm", "--filter", "Fansmodule.Moid eq '[{#MOID}]'"]),"No Active Alarms")=0
trigger_prototypes.name: Fan {#ID} - Active Alarms

trigger_prototypes.expression: in(last(/Cisco Intersight Rackservers/isctl["get", "cond", "alarm", "--filter", "Psus.Moid eq '[{#MOID}]'"]),"No Active Alarms")=0
trigger_prototypes.name: PSU {#ID} - Active Alarms

triggers.name: ConnectionStatus needs investigation
triggers.description: Compare connectionStatus with ConnectionPath, if not equal, something might be wrong
